title: [Massive] Online Self-Directed Learning Project for Maintaining Functional Abilities in Parkinson’s Patients

context.prior_knowledge: General understanding of basic physiology and neuroscience
context.additional_context: Learners analyze online self-directed content for maintaining functional abilities in Parkinson’s patients, propose effective instructional design solutions, and gain experience evaluating/developing digital learning materials

learning_goals: Learners can identify three major functional issues in Parkinson’s patients (gait disorders, balance problems, difficulty performing daily activities), analyze three self-learning videos per issue (9 total), and propose ≥5 specific improvements (e.g., "introducing real-time feedback systems for gait training") in a proposal format, covering educational content (3 key points), visual aids (2 types), and interaction features (≥1).

Applying instructional design principles (ADDIE model, SAM model, etc.), learners can select three educational videos for Parkinson’s patients and write a quality evaluation report achieving an "excellent" rating (4/5 points) in ≥4 out of 5 evaluation criteria (clarity, accessibility, engagement, medical accuracy, cultural appropriateness).

Learners will apply patient-centered design principles (accessibility, personalization, interactivity) in public/nonprofit educational contexts over six months, designing one prototype (including storyboard/wireframe) for online learning content development and obtaining feedback averaging 4.0 or higher on a 5-point scale from an expert evaluation panel.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
